Case Study

case_study.Rmd

Data: \(n = 1,544\), \(\pi_0 = 1/758\), \(r = 5\) and \(r_0 = 3\).

library(CPreval)

# Data:
n = 1544
r = 5
pi0 = 1/758
r0 = 3

Without measurement error

survey_sample(R = r, n = n, pi0 = pi0)
## Method: Survey sample
## 
## Estimated proportion: 0.3238%
## Standard error      : 0.1446%
## 
## Confidence intervals at the 95% level:
## Asymptotic Approach: 0.0404% - 0.6072%
## Clopper–Pearson    : 0.1319% - 0.7541%
## 
## Assumed measurement error: alpha = 0%, beta = 0%
mle(R = r, R0 = r0, n = n, pi0 = pi0)
## Method: MLE
## 
## Estimated proportion: 0.2615%
## Standard error      : 0.0916%
## 
## Confidence intervals at the 95% level:
## Asymptotic Approach: 0.0821% - 0.4410%
## Clopper–Pearson    : 0.1476% - 0.5991%
## 
## Assumed measurement error: alpha0 = 0%, alpha = 0%, 
##                            beta0  = 0%, beta  = 0%

With measurment error (Setting I)

# Assumptions
alpha = alpha0 = 0.005
beta = 0.025
beta0 = 0.05
survey_sample(R = r, n = n, pi0 = pi0, alpha = alpha, beta = beta)
## Warning in survey_sample(R = r, n = n, pi0 = pi0, alpha = alpha, beta = beta):
## The estimator has no (reliable) solution.
## Method: Survey sample
## 
## Estimated proportion: 0.1319%
## Standard error      : NA%
## 
## Confidence intervals at the 95% level:
## Asymptotic Approach: NA% - NA%
## Clopper–Pearson    : 0.1319% - 0.2619%
## 
## Assumed measurement error: alpha = 0.5%, beta = 2.5%
mle(R = r, R0 = r0, n = n, pi0 = pi0, alpha = alpha, beta = beta, alpha0 = alpha0, beta0 = beta0)
## Method: MLE
## 
## Estimated proportion: 0.1821%
## Standard error      : 0.0375%
## 
## Confidence intervals at the 95% level:
## Asymptotic Approach: 0.1086% - 0.2556%
## Clopper–Pearson    : 0.1319% - 0.4485%
## 
## Assumed measurement error: alpha0 = 0.5%, alpha = 0.5%, 
##                            beta0  = 5%, beta  = 2.5%

Sensitivity to \(R_0\)

With measurment error (Setting II)

# Assumptions
alpha = alpha0 = 0.001
beta = 0.025
beta0 = 0.05
survey_sample(R = r, n = n, pi0 = pi0, alpha = alpha, beta = beta)
## Method: Survey sample
## 
## Estimated proportion: 0.2298%
## Standard error      : 0.1219%
## 
## Confidence intervals at the 95% level:
## Asymptotic Approach: -0.0090% - 0.4687%
## Clopper–Pearson    : 0.1319% - 0.6716%
## 
## Assumed measurement error: alpha = 0.1%, beta = 2.5%
mle(R = r, R0 = r0, n = n, pi0 = pi0, alpha = alpha, beta = beta, alpha0 = alpha0, beta0 = beta0)
## Method: MLE
## 
## Estimated proportion: 0.2138%
## Standard error      : 0.0716%
## 
## Confidence intervals at the 95% level:
## Asymptotic Approach: 0.0734% - 0.3543%
## Clopper–Pearson    : 0.1319% - 0.5629%
## 
## Assumed measurement error: alpha0 = 0.1%, alpha = 0.1%, 
##                            beta0  = 5%, beta  = 2.5%

Sensitivity to \(R_0\)
